@0xCato I kinda disagree. In Crypto Cities, Vitalik lays out a case for specific regional currencies running in DeFi. I think a CBDC (if well designed) could just be a slightly less local version of this. 
Plus crypto is permissionless. If a government wants to mint some coins, they can.

@myfairjulia @ThaumPenguin energy sources (hopefully renewable). Then when demand and prices spike, miners take demand away, leveling out the stress on the system. The added power to meet low demand is now helping meet demand at peak as well. Then as demand falls, miners start up again.

@myfairjulia @ThaumPenguin Thatâ€™s about right. Bitcoin mining is only profitable up to a certain point, and above that point most miners will scale down mining. So at off-peak, miners provide constant demand making energy production more profitable, energy companies are incentivized to add more cheap â€¦
